ai-vv11:0.4_0: The First Shackle of the Mind
ai-vv11:1.1_0: “Whose thieves have been given to me,
ai-vv11:1.3_0: I’ve come to this sal tree all crowned with flowers,
ai-vv11:2.1_0: There the Queen By in that place
ai-vv11:2.3_0: and there are these nymphs for you.
ai-vv11:3.1_0: he gave the gift of the Queen Mahāvihāra and have the mighty power of that great (magical) power.
ai-vv11:3.3_0: Whose mind is developed like this?
ai-vv11:4.3_0: asked a question, and he answered the questions.
ai-vv11:4.4_0: It is the fruit of that deed,
ai-vv11:5.2_0: and she became saved and thought.
ai-vv11:5.3_0: looking after her husband like a mother her child.
ai-vv11:5.4_0: When I was speaking harshly, I said to him:
ai-vv11:8.1_0: I am a mendicant blind and mighty.
ai-vv11:8.2_0: A human beings lived for merit;
ai-vv11:8.3_0: and that by the power of this I developed
ai-vv11:8.4_0: and my complexion was like me.”
ai-vv11:9.1_0: The first one hundred and seventy-eight meditations added,
